alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Graham; Norton; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 8:50AM CDT until May 09 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT FOR NORTON...NORTHERN SHERIDAN...SOUTHEASTERN DECATUR AND NORTHERN GRAHAM COUNTIES... At 849 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles southeast of Oberlin, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public reported golf ball size hail in Oberlin. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Norton, Almena, Lenora, Selden, Norcatur, Jennings and Clayton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
